TopicTitle: To RSS or not to RSS?

Articles.Content:
So a few weeks ago I finally switched to RSS after much deliberation. I've done everything in Kerbal that I thought was hard so it was time to switch. However, I deleted RSS again because it was causing some VERY weird glitches to happen. But I loved the size and the challenge.

I just don't think it's worth deleting a bunch of mods to keep it around (I tested it out, I had to delete almost everything to get nearly no glitching, and I can run TONS of mods on stock).

I just wish Kerbal could be the size of the real solar system without glitching. Or at least that we could have an option to choose like on a save-game basis.
This add-on discussion moved to the add-on discussion area.

Why not both?

Seriously though, keep separate installs. I have 3 or 4 installs of KSP, all with different mod set-ups. For KSP Store version, just copy paste the folder (or unzip another folder from the ZIP file that was downloaded). For Steam, it's the same process, just navigate to where the game files are in Steam and copy-paste that somewhere!

RSS is quite fun and I'll make stuff in it every once in a while.

Just use HyperEditTM

But then again you would have to put the planets back in place whenever you open KSP.
